name: Avoid setting an event handler like onclick, onmouseover, onsubmit... using element.setAttribute() (Javascript)
description:
This rule will detect the use of element.setAttribute(...) to set an event handler.

Setting an event handler like onclick using element.setAttribute() is dangerous because it essentially performs a mini-eval() on the string you provide. The browser doesn't treat the string as simple text; it parses and executes it as JavaScript code when the event (e.g., a click) occurs.

This creates a powerful injection sink for Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
remediation: Ensure you don't set an event handler using element.setAttribute(), prefer using addEventListener().
alternativeName: Ensure you don't set an event handler using element.setAttribute()
